alert.note: Alert for Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 04 at 11:03AM EST until January 04 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EST FOR CENTRAL CALHOUN...SOUTHEASTERN LEXINGTON...NORTH CENTRAL ORANGEBURG AND SOUTHEASTERN RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 1103 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles south of Sandy Run, or 14 miles northwest of Brookdale, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... St. Matthews around 1120 AM EST. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 129 and 140. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately. This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
